item.title: [PI] 2 errors, random events [Help]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

… genieLamp is a method. Not a integer. So you would need to put genieLamp();
Put parameters inside of () if needed, but in this case you don’t need to, since genieLamp doesn’t require any parameters.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] 2 errors, random events [Help]
item.dc:creator: @mr_pker01 mr pker01
item.description:
@mr_pker01 wrote:

src\server\model\players\Client.java:84: missing method body, or declare abstrac t public int genieLamp(); ^ src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:104: operator || cannot be applied to boolean,int if (c.fishing || c.isMining || c.playerIsWoodcutting) { ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

the code is:

public void genieLamp() { if (c.fishing || c.isMining || c.playerIsWoodcutting) { if (Misc.random(3500) == 1) { c.stopMoving = true; EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer C) { removeAllWindows(); c.getPA().showInterface(2808); c.startAnimation(65535); c.sendMessage("Please Select The Skill You Wish To Advance In."); C.stop(); // stops the event from running } }, 1500); } } }

Read full topic
